target.name: BridgeHead
target.text: Create the Team Creator Group:

target.name: Procedure
target.text: In the ICEcore Administration portlet, click Manage Groups.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the ICEcore Administration portlet, click Manage Groups.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Manage Groups window, click Add a New Group.

target.name: Step
target.text: Enter the new group's name, title, description, and then click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Select a Group to Modify or Delete, click the Team Creator (Team Creator) group.

target.name: Step
target.text: Add users to the group and click Apply.

target.name: Step

target.name: BridgeHead

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Click Team Workspace.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Team Workspace.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Manage > Access Control menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add a Group in the Access Rights table.

target.name: Step
target.text: Start typing Team Creator in the Add a Group dialog that appears and select Team Creator from the drop-down list that appears.

target.name: Step

target.name: Step

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From your Home Page, click Team Workspaces.

target.name: Step
target.text: From your Home Page, click Team Workspaces.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add a Team Workspace.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type in a Workspace Title for the new workspace.

target.name: Step

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Mirrored Folders Configuration

target.name: BridgeHead
target.text: To Create a Mirrored Folder:

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Add a "MirroredFolder" section to the installer.xml file. This creates a Mirrored Folder Resource Driver. (You may want to use one of the disabled samples as a template.)

target.name: Step
target.text: Add a "MirroredFolder" section to the installer.xml file. This creates a Mirrored Folder Resource Driver. (You may want to use one of the disabled samples as a template.)

target.name: Step
target.text: Log into Novell Teaming as one of the users you specified in the mirrored folder resource driver (or as a member of one of the specified groups).

target.name: Step
target.text: In Novell Teaming, create a folder of type File folder.

target.name: Step
target.text: Within the folder, select the Manage > Modify this folder menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Mirror external folders option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the mirrored folder resource driver that you created in step 1.

target.name: Step
target.text: Optionally, you can specify a subdirectory within the resource driver's root directory structure that you want this folder to mirror.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK to make the folder a mirrored folder.

target.name: Step
target.text: Perform initial synchronization/loading by selecting the Manage this folder > Synchronize menu item from the folder listing.
